clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of Decision Aids on Bariatric Surgery Choice
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Decision Aids on Bariatric Surgery Choice: A Randomized Controlled Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Taipei Medical University Shuang Ho Hospital

clinical_study.source: Taipei Medical University Shuang Ho Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: Sleeve gastrectomy, Roux-en-Y gastric bypass, laparoscopic gastric banding, and bioenteric intragastric balloon insertion are common types of bariatric surgeries. These treatment strategies have diverted outcomes in body weight loss, metabolic diseases control, surgical complications, and life quality improvement. Thus, shared decision making (SDM) is necessary to aid patients to choose an appropriate treatment that suits thier needs. Investigators have developed a decision aids (DAs) and plan to conduct a randomized controlled trial (RCT) to evaluate its impact on obese patients. The measurements include a battery of interview-based questionnaires and evaluations of decision regret and knowledge improvement. Investigators expect the DAs would benefit the intervention group in the aspects of knowledge, communication and anxiety status during and after their treatment sessions.

primary_outcome.description: Total scores of decisional conflict scale

arm_group.description: Shared decision making using decision aids
Standard oral explanation guided with booklets

intervention.intervention_name: Shared decision making with decision aids
intervention.description: For obese patients, we use shared decision making with decision aids to help them choose the suitable types of bariatric surgery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Body mass index (BMI) ≧ 32 kg / m2 with obesity-related comorbidity
2. Body mass index (BMI) ≧ 37 kg / m2
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Endocrine system abnormalities in patients
2. Drug abuse or mental illness
3. Major organ dysfunction and can accept surgery
4. Patients cannot understand Chinese
5. Age less than 20 years old or more than 70 years old
